intents.response: Hi! Welcome to CUET Assistant ğŸ‘‹ How can I help you today?

examples: how far is cuet from city
intents.response: ğŸ“ CUET is located in **Raozan, Chittagong**, beside the Kaptai Highway. It is approximately **25km** from Chittagong city center (Bahaddarhat).

ğŸšŒ CUET has a dedicated bus fleet. Buses usually leave campus at **1:15 PM, 2:30 PM, and 5:30 PM**. 
Note: Schedules change during exams/holidays, so always check the notice board.

examples: how to go to city without bus
intents.response: ğŸ›º If you miss the university bus, you can take a **CNG** or local bus (like 'Paharika' or 'Drutojan') from the CUET Main Gate to Bahaddarhat or Kaptai Raster Matha.
ğŸ¥ The **CUET Medical Center** is open **24/7** for emergencies. It provides free basic treatment, medicine, and has an ambulance service for referrals to city hospitals.
ğŸš€ **Sheikh Kamal IT Business Incubator** at CUET is the first campus-based incubator in Bangladesh! It supports startups, innovation, and provides office space for tech companies.
ğŸ—“ï¸ The weekly holidays are usually **Thursday and Friday**. Administrative offices are open Sunday to Wednesday (9 AM - 5 PM).
ğŸ’» **CSE (Computer Science & Engineering)** is a top-tier department known for its programming culture. It has advanced labs for AI, Robotics, and Networking.
âš™ï¸ **Mechanical Engineering (ME)** is a core engineering branch at CUET with state-of-the-art labs for Thermodynamics, Fluid Mechanics, and Heat Engine research.
ğŸ›ï¸ The **Department of Architecture** (est. 2009) focuses on sustainable design and urban planning. Students here participate in rigorous design studios and jury presentations.
ğŸ“ Admission is via the **Cluster System (CKRuET)**. There are approximately **920+ seats** available across all departments. Check the official website for the latest circular.

ğŸŒ³ Popular hangout spots include:
1. **Gol Chattar** (The main roundabout)
2. **Shantir Dip** (Peace Island)
3. **Central Field**
4. **Joy Bangla Sculpture**
ğŸ›’ For daily needs, students go to **Pahartali** (just outside the main gate). For bigger shopping, students travel to **Kaptai Raster Matha** or the city.
ğŸ  CUET has 5 male halls (Bangabandhu, Shaheed Smriti, QK, TBH, Ahsanullah) and 1 female hall (Sufia Kamal). Halls are allotted based on merit and distance.

ğŸš Hall dining operates on a token system.
**Lunch:** 1:00 PM - 2:30 PM
**Dinner:** 8:00 PM - 9:30 PM.
Tokens must be bought in the morning.
ğŸš« **Zero Tolerance:** Ragging is strictly prohibited at CUET. If you face any harassment, report immediately to the **Proctorial Body** or Student Welfare Director.

ğŸš€ Vibrant clubs at CUET:
- **Robotics Club**
- **Debating Society**
- **Computer Club**
- **Photography Society**
- **Green for Peace**
- **Joydhoni** (Cultural)
ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ« The current Head of the Department of CSE is **Prof. Dr. Pranab Kumar Dhar**. You can find him in the CSE office on the 2nd floor of the Academic Building.

ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ« The CSE department has a distinguished faculty team including **Prof. Dr. Kaushik Deb, Prof. Dr. Md. Ibrahim Khan, and Prof. Dr. Asaduzzaman**. There are over 35+ faculty members specializing in AI, Data Science, and Systems.

examples: what do we study in cse
intents.response:
ğŸ“š The CSE curriculum covers 160+ credits over 4 years. Key courses include:
- **Structured & Object Oriented Programming**
- **Data Structures & Algorithms**
- **Discrete Math**
- **Database Systems**
- **Artificial Intelligence**
- **Compiler Design**

ğŸ”¬ Major research areas in CUET CSE include:
- **Computer Vision & Image Processing**
- **Natural Language Processing (NLP)**
- **Bioinformatics**
- **Cyber Security**
- **Internet of Things (IoT)**

ğŸ† **Pride of CUET:**
- Regular **ICPC World Finals** qualifiers.
- Champions in **NASA Space Apps Challenge** (multiple years).
- Top rankings in **NCPC** and **Inter-University Hackathons**.

ğŸš€ **CSE Student Activities:**
- **CUET Computer Club (CCC):** Organizes workshops and fests.
- **ACCE:** The association of CSE students.
- **IEEE CS Student Branch:** For research and seminars.

ğŸ‰ The department organizes a grand **CSE Fest** annually! It features:
- **CodeStorm** (Programming Contest)
- **Robo-Soccer**
- **Project Showcasing**
- **Gaming Contest** (FIFA/Valorant)
- **Cultural Night**
ğŸ’¼ CUET CSE graduates are working globally at **Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Agoda**, and top local firms like **Therap, BJIT, and Enosis**. Many are also pursuing PhDs in USA/Canada.

ğŸ“ **CSE Department Office:**
- **Location:** 2nd Floor, New Academic Building (Block B).
- **Email:** headcse@cuet.ac.bd
- **Website:** cuet.ac.bd/department/cse
âš¡ **EEE (Electrical & Electronic Engineering)** is one of the oldest and largest departments at CUET. It focuses on Power Systems, Electronics, and Telecommunications.
ğŸ—ï¸ **Civil Engineering (CE)** is the founding department of CUET. It houses the massive **Concrete Lab** and **Environmental Engineering Lab** and conducts vital research on earthquake resistance.
ğŸ“¡ **ETE (Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering)** focuses on wireless communication, optical fibers, and signal processing. It is located in the new academic block.
ğŸ¤– **MIE (Mechatronics & Industrial Engineering)** combines robotics, control systems, and manufacturing management. It is a multidisciplinary department bridging Mech and EEE.
cityscape **URP (Urban & Regional Planning)** deals with town planning, GIS, and disaster management. Students often work on real-world city projects.
â›ï¸ **PME (Petroleum & Mining Engineering)** is a unique department at CUET, focusing on energy resources, gas fields, and mining technology.
ğŸ’§ **WRE (Water Resources Engineering)** focuses on hydraulics, river engineering, and fluid dynamics. It plays a key role in national water management research.
ğŸ§¬ **Biomedical Engineering (BME)** is one of the newest departments, merging engineering with medical science to develop prosthetics and medical devices.
ğŸ§ª **MSE (Materials Science & Engineering)** studies the properties of matter, nanotechnology, and new material development for industry.
ğŸ¢ The **Registrar Office** is located on the Ground Floor of the **Administrative Building**. They handle official files, recruitment, and legal matters.
ğŸ“ The **Controller of Examinations** office is in the Administrative Building. Visit here for transcripts, certificates, and exam-related corrections.
ğŸ¤ **DSW (Director of Students' Welfare)** oversees student activities, club approvals, and discipline. The office is located near the Auditorium complex.
ğŸ“š The **Central Library** is a distinct building near the turning point of the main road. It has a vast collection of engineering texts, journals, and a quiet reading room.
ğŸ’³ To get a **Library Card**, submit the application form (available at the counter) along with a passport-size photo and your student ID copy to the librarian.

â° **Library Hours:**
Sunday - Wednesday: 9:00 AM - 8:00 PM
Thursday: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM
(Hours may vary during vacations).
ğŸ•Œ The **Central Mosque** is located atop a scenic hill near the main gate. It is the largest prayer space on campus and hosts Jumma prayers for everyone.
ğŸ›• There is a designated prayer room/mandir for Hindu students located near the residential halls for daily worship and festivals.
ğŸ¦ **Rupali Bank** has a branch inside the campus (near the Post Office). This is where you typically pay semester fees and hall dues.

ğŸ§ **ATM Booths:**
1. Dutch-Bangla Bank (DBBL) ATM near the Main Gate.
2. Rupali Bank ATM near the Bank branch.
ywğŸ“® The **Campus Post Office** is located in the utility building area. The postal code for CUET is **4349**.
ğŸ” The **Central Cafeteria** is located near the Administrative Building. It serves breakfast, lunch, and snacks at subsidized rates for students and staff.
ğŸ­ **TSC (Teacher-Student Center)** includes the Auditorium and club rooms. It is the hub for cultural activities, fests, and large seminars.
ğŸ‹ï¸â€â™‚ï¸ The **CUET Gymnasium** is well-equipped for students. It is located near the Central Field and includes weights, treadmills, and table tennis facilities.
âš½ The **Central Field** is huge and hosts inter-department football and cricket tournaments. It is located in the valley between the academic blocks and halls.

ğŸ€ **Sports Courts:**
- Basketball Court (near Hall Gate)
- Tennis Court (near Staff Quarters)
- Volleyball/Badminton courts are available in every hall.
ğŸ  **Bangabandhu Hall** is one of the largest male halls, located centrally. It is known for its pond view and vibrant student politics.
ğŸ  **Shaheed Smriti Hall** is located on the southern side of the campus. It has a strong sports culture and its own dining facilities.
ğŸ  **Dr. Qudrat-E-Khuda Hall (QK Hall)** is situated near the hill slope. It is known for its peaceful environment and strong alumni network.
ğŸ  **Sufia Kamal Hall** is the main female residence. It has high security, an internal garden, a canteen, and strict entry timings for safety.
ğŸ  **Sheikh Russel Hall** is the newest addition to CUET's residential facilities, featuring modern architecture and improved amenities.
ğŸ“„ To get an **Official Transcript**, apply through the Controller of Examinations office with the required fee receipt from Rupali Bank.
ğŸ“ **Provisional Certificates** are issued after you complete all credits. You need to submit a clearance form signed by Hall, Library, and Dept.
âœ… **Clearance Process:** Before graduation or receiving certificates, you must obtain 'No Dues' signatures from your Hall Provost, Librarian, DSW, and Dept Head.
ğŸ“¶ To access **CUET Wi-Fi**, register your device MAC address at the **IICT Office**. They will provide you with a unique username and password.
ğŸ“§ Every student gets a **@cuet.ac.bd** email address. This email gives you unlimited Google Drive storage and discounts on software like GitHub/JetBrains.
ğŸ’» **IICT (Institute of Information & Communication Technology)** manages the campus network. It is located in the New Academic Building.
ğŸ¢ **PMEC (Pre-Engineering Building)** is the oldest academic block. It currently houses the Civil Engineering department and several main lecture galleries.
ğŸ“ **West Gallery** is a famous large lecture hall in the PMEC building, used for combined classes and exams.
ğŸšŒ **Teacher/Staff Buses** have different schedules and colors (usually White/AC). Students are generally not allowed on these unless permitted during emergencies.
ğŸšŒ **Weekend Bus Service:** On Fridays and Saturdays, bus frequency is reduced. Usually, there is one morning trip (around 8-9 AM) and one evening trip. Check the notice board for exact times.
ğŸ’° **Board Scholarships** and Govt Stipends are processed through the Academic Section. Keep an eye on the notice board for application deadlines.
ğŸ¶ **Joydhoni** is the cultural organization of CUET. They organize musical nights, Baishakhi Utshob, and cultural competitions.
ğŸŒ¿ **Green For Peace** is a voluntary organization focusing on environmental awareness, tree plantation, and social welfare activities.
ğŸ¨ **Graffiti** is the art club of CUET. They are responsible for the beautiful wall art and alpanas you see around campus during festivals.
ğŸ¤– **Robo Mechatronics Club (RMC)** is the hub for robotics enthusiasts. They conduct workshops on Arduino, IoT, and participate in Robo Wars.
ğŸ—£ï¸ **CUET Debating Society (CUETDS)** is one of the most active clubs, organizing inter-department and inter-university debate championships.
ğŸ”¥ In case of fire, alert the security immediately. The nearest Fire Service station is in **Raozan** and **Kaptai Road**.
ğŸ‘® **Campus Security** is available 24/7 at the Main Gate and Hall Gates. For immediate help, contact the Proctorial Body.
ğŸ¡ CUET has a **Guest House** and **Cum-Club** for visiting faculty and parents. Prior booking through the Registrar's office is required.
ğŸ§  The **Student Welfare Office** arranges psychological counseling. If you are feeling stressed or depressed, please reach out to the Student Advisor of your department.
ğŸ“ **Short Term/Supplementary Exams** are held after the main results for students with backlogs (F grades). You must register for these courses separately.
ğŸ“Š Each course is assigned **Credits** (usually 3.0 or 1.5). You must complete approx 160-162 credits (depending on dept) to graduate.
ğŸ“ **Convocation** is the grand graduation ceremony. It is held periodically. Graduates must register online when the circular is published by the Controller of Exams.
ğŸ¤ The **CUET Alumni Association** is a strong network of graduates working globally. They organize reunions and offer mentorship to current students.
ğŸ¸ The **Rag Concert** is the farewell musical event organized by the graduating batch, featuring top bands from the country.
âš™ï¸ **Yantrakoushol** is the signature tech fest of the Mechanical Engineering department, featuring CAD contests and engine assembly challenges.
ğŸ—ï¸ **CENOVATION** is the national tech fest organized by the Civil Engineering department, famous for its bridge-building and concrete cube contests.
âš¡ **Tariit** (or similar EEE fests) are organized by the EEE department, focusing on circuit solving, robotics, and project showcasing.
ğŸŒŠ The **Lake/Pond** in front of Bangabandhu Hall is a scenic spot, especially during sunset. It's a favorite place for students to relax.
ğŸ”ï¸ CUET is a **Green Campus** nestled among hills. Students often hike up to the Water Tank hill or the Observatory hill for a panoramic view.
â˜ï¸ Being in a hilly area, CUET experiences **heavy rainfall** during monsoons and can be quite foggy in winter. Always carry an umbrella!
ğŸ‘• There is no strict **Uniform**, but students are expected to wear **decent and formal/semi-formal attire** in classes and labs. Sandals/slippers are often discouraged in labs.
ğŸ†” You must carry your **Student ID** at all times. If lost, file a GD at the police station and apply for a replacement at the Proctor's office.
ğŸšŒ **City Bus Route:** Campus -> Raozan -> Kaptai Road -> Mohra -> Bahaddarhat -> GEC -> New Market (routes vary by bus number).
ğŸ•’ The **Central Cafeteria** is usually open from **7:30 AM to 9:00 PM**. Hall dining times are strictly for Lunch (1-2:30) and Dinner (8-9:30).
bğŸ§º Every residential hall has a **Laundry Shop** nearby where you can get clothes washed and ironed at a cheap rate.
âœ‚ï¸ There are **Barber Shops** (Saloons) located in the market area near the staff quarters and near the main hall gates.
ğŸ›ï¸ There are **Departmental Stores** within the campus staff market and small shops in every hall gate for daily necessities.
ğŸ–¨ï¸ **Photocopy Centers** are available in the **TSC**, **Library**, and **Staff Market**. They also offer binding services for thesis papers.
ğŸ…¿ï¸ Students can park bicycles and motorbikes in designated **Parking Sheds** near the academic buildings and halls.
ğŸ” **Lost & Found:** If you lose or find something, please report it to the **Student Welfare Office** or post in the 'CUET Family' Facebook group.
ğŸ­ On **Rag Day**, graduating students wear colorful costumes, organize flashmobs, and parade around the campus celebrating their journey.
ğŸ”¬ CUET has several research wings, including the **Bureau of Research, Testing and Consultation (BRTC)**, which handles industrial projects.
ğŸ­ **Industrial Attachment:** Departments arrange internships for 3rd/4th-year students at companies like KAFCO, TSP, BSRM, and Power Plants.
ğŸ¢ The **Vice-Chancellor's Office** is on the 1st/2nd floor of the Administrative Building. Appointments are usually required to meet him.
âš–ï¸ The **Proctor's Office** handles security and discipline. It is located in the Administrative Building. The Proctorial body patrols the campus regularly.
ğŸ¢ The **New Academic Building** houses the CSE, ETE, and several other departments. It is a multi-storied complex with elevators.
ğŸ’§ **Drinking Water:** Most academic buildings and halls have water purifiers/filters. It is advisable to carry a water bottle.
âš¡ CUET has its own **Power Station** and heavy-duty generators. Academic areas rarely face outages, but halls might experience scheduled load shedding.
ğŸ¥½ **Safety First:** You must wear an **Apron** and **Safety Shoes** in Mechanical and Civil labs. Goggles are mandatory for Chemistry labs.
ğŸ“¢ **Student Union:** While there is no central student union election recently, department associations and clubs represent student interests.
ğŸŒ CUET welcomes international students (mostly from Nepal, Sri Lanka, Somalia) under specific quotas. Applications are routed through the Ministry of Education.
ğŸŒ² The CUET campus spans approximately **188 acres** of lush green hills and valleys.
ğŸ’» **Online Classes** are conducted via Zoom/Google Meet during emergencies or special circumstances. Links are provided by the Class Representatives (CR).
ğŸ—£ï¸ **Class Representative (CR):** Two students (1 male, 1 female) are selected per section to liaise between teachers and students regarding schedules and notes.
ğŸ« You must download and print your **Admit Card** from the student portal before every semester final exam. Without it, entry to the exam hall is denied.
ğŸš‘ **Ambulance Service:** Available 24/7. Save the Medical Center hotline number (available on the website/diary) for emergencies.
ğŸ“ **General Helpline:** For general queries, call the Registrar's office PABX or check the 'Contact Us' section on www.cuet.ac.bd.
ğŸ”Œ For electronic components (Arduino, sensors), students usually go to **Ice Factory Road** in Chittagong city, though some basics are available at local shops.
ğŸ“š **Book Shops** inside the campus sell notebooks, pens, and lab manuals. For academic textbooks, the library or Anderkilla (city) is best.
ğŸ“½ï¸ **Project Showcasing** is a common part of fests where students display their semester projects to judges and industry experts.
ğŸ’» **Competitive Programming** is huge at CUET. Regular contests are hosted in the CSE labs on platforms like Codeforces and Toph.
ğŸ“ CUET offers **M.Sc., M.Engg., and Ph.D.** programs in most engineering departments. Admission circulars are usually published twice a year.
ğŸ›‹ï¸ The **Faculty Lounge** is a restricted area in the TSC/Admin building for teachers to relax and dine.
ğŸ“… **Exam Routines** are published by the Controller of Exams 2-3 weeks before the finals. They are displayed on department notice boards.
ğŸ“– **PL (Preparatory Leave):** Students typically get 2-3 weeks of study leave before the Semester Final exams begin.
ğŸ¤ The **Central Auditorium** hosts major events like Orientations, National Days, and Cultural Fests. It has a seating capacity of over 1000.
ğŸ« **Bus Service is technically free** for students (included in semester fees). You just need to show your Student ID if asked.
